Problem:
Analyze the system governed by a linear time-invariant differential operator \\( L \\) operating on a function \\( u(t) \\), and consider the effects of an integral transformation \\( T[u(t)] = \\int_{0}^{\\infty} e^{-st} u(t) dt \\). Assume \\( L[u(t)] = -u''(t) + 3u'(t) - 2u(t) \\), and study the Laplace transform effects.

If \\( T[u(t)] \\) is applied to function \\( u(t) \\) and the result is then processed with the differential operator \\( L \\), without any additional transformation, will the sequence \\( L[T[u(t)]] \\) equal to \\( T[L[u(t)]] \\)?
Explanation: The Laplace transform is a linear operator, which commutes with linear differential operators whose coefficients do not depend on the variable of transformation (time in this case). Thus, applying \\( L \\) after \\( T \\) yields the same result as first applying \\( L \\) to \\( u(t) \\) and then transforming the result.
